selection1.name:
Every fool finds a greater one to admire them.
Nicolas Boileau

Take all the fools pout of this world and there would not be any fun living in it, or profit.
Josh Billings

For fools rush in where angels fear to tread.
Alexander Pope

Fortune, seeing that she could not make fools wise, has made them lucky.
Michel de Montaigne

It is human nature to think wisely and act foolishly.
Anatole France

Lord, what fools these mortals be.
William Shakespeare

Mix a little foolishness with your prudence: It’s good to be silly at the right moment.
Horace

None but a fool is always right.
Augustus William Hare

Silence is the wit of fools.
Jean la Bruyere

Take all the fools out of this world and there wouldn’t be any fun living in it, or profit.
Josh Billings

The first of April is the day we remember what we are the other 364 days of the year.
Mark Twain

The fool doth think he is wise, but the wise man knows himself a fool.
William Shakespeare

The fool is always beginning to live.
Proverb

Let us be thankful for the fools.but for them the rest of us could not succeed .
Mark Twain
Today is the day to propose. If she accepts, great, if not just say April Fools

The aim of a joke is not to degrade the human being, but to remind him that he is already degraded.
George Orwell

A wise man never knows all, only fools know everything.
Proverb quotes

You can fool all the people some of the time, and some of the people all the time, but you cannot fool all the people all the time.
Abraham Lincoln

Walk away from anything or anyone who takes away from your joy. Life is too short to put up with fools.
- Unknown
Happy Fool's Day Everything is funny as long as it is happening to somebody else.

Real friends are those who, when you feel you've made a fool of yourself, don't feel you've done a permanent job.
~Author Unknown

I have great faith in fools - self-confidence, my friends call it.
~Edgar Allan Poe

Don't give cherries to pigs or advice to fools.
~Irish Proverb

April 1st This is the day upon which we are reminded of what we are on the other three hundred and sixty-four.
~Mark Twain

The trouble with practical jokes is that very often they get elected.
~Will Rogers

It is better to weep with wise men than to laugh with fools.
~Spanish Proverb
Even the gods love jokes. ~Plato

We're fools whether we dance or not, so we might as well dance.
~Japanese Proverb

If every fool wore a crown, we should all be kings.
~Welsh Proverb

He who is born a fool is never cured.
~Proverb

Fool me once, shame on you; fool me twice, shame on me.
~Chinese Proverb

April fool, n. The March fool with another month added to his folly.
~Ambrose Bierce, The Devil's Dictionary
Those who wish to appear wise among fools, among the wise seem foolish.
April Fools gone past, and you're the biggest fool at last.
